TopicTitle: Hunt for the Kerbol Bodies =Space Engine Adventure=

Articles.Content:
Hey guys,I saw some dude discovered a duna like planet today and I wanted to make something to discover ALL the planets/moons in the kerbol system. (The moons could be a planet,it just has to look like that type of moon. And vice versa)

So far here is what I got. (Ill put screenies of the planets/moons if I found it)

Kerbol:

Duh,Its the dingdung sun.

?

Ill keep this thread updated,if you like it,just clicky on the poll up there!

Duna and Ike have been found, their names are:

Duna... 22 And 4

Ike... 22 And 4.1

22 And is their star's name.

Considering I like searching around in SpaceEngine regardless, searching for Kerbal Space Program planets seems fun.

Sign me up.

Edit: I think I found a Tylo-ish body. It is a white moon with craters (it looks like Tylo to me OK?). It is even orbiting a green gas giant!

I don't know how to post screenshots from SpaceEngine, because I forgot where I put my SpaceEngine folder, so here's it's name:

RS 8405-6-8-3521941-256 2.1

Now I just need to figure out how to copy paste in space engine

Great news! I found 2 jool like gas giants,1 pol looking planet AND 1 tylo looking moon!

Alright, the name of the star(s) (there are four ) is RS 8405-6-8-3521941-256

Edit: Found a Eve looking planet!

Star's name: RS 8405-6-6-55193-705 Planet is the eighth from the star.

The only downside is that it has rings, but hey, if Eve had rings, it would look beautiful. Plus the rings are not the noticeable.

Plus plus, its star is a yellow dwarf, just like Kerbol

P.S 100 POSTS! 1/5 away!

I found Laythe

Star name:

RSC 8404-8009-2-28-1931

Planet name:

RSC 8404-8009-2-28-1931 A4

(such creative names, I know)

Its a Oceania/Terra with life, and it has tons of oceans, and islands similar to that of Lathe.

The unacurate things are: A planet, not a moon, no gas giant, in a globular cluster (but, y'know, its beautiful so, meh), FOUR stars

By the way, evaporating planets!

Star name:

RS 8404-2737-6-176982-0

My first one with evaporating planets, plus a great view of the milky way, and a great view of a globular cluster!

this thing just blows my mind.

HIP 95603/HD 182394
Ill bring it up once again! I found a few planets,Ill post them soon.
I know this is a month old,but I MUST not give up!

I've been throughout the SE Milky Way Galaxy, and I've found planets similar to those in stock and modded KSP. Here's a list of stock planets in SE:

  • Jool (I found several Jool-like gas planets)
  • Laythe (It's a habitable world with jungle-filled islands like on Laythe)
  • Eve (Every single habitable desert planet with purple life)
  • Gilly (It's so easy to find)
  • Duna (Also sort-of easy)
  • Tylo (Giant "Super-Earth" selena-class moons of gas giants)
  • Bop (Easy to find, too)
  • Eeloo (It's a no-brainer: Europa)

Now it's time for the modded planets in SE!

  • Sarnus from Outer Planets Mod (It orbits a major star in Capricornus)
  • Chani from Chani Planet Pack
  • Laythe from Alternis Kerbol Regiggered (Same planet as stock Laythe)
  • Tel from Saru Planet Pack
  • Krios from Othrys Planet Pack
  • Vassa from Other_Worlds
  • Troni from Other_Worlds
  • Pequar from Other_Worlds
  • Prima and Secunda from Other_Worlds
  • Mobe from Saru Planet Pack
  • Sentar from Planet Factory
  • Skelton from Planet Factory
  • Ablate from Planet Factory
  • Urlum from Outer Planets Mod
  • Priax from Outer Planets Mod
  • Ovok from Outer Planets Mod
  • Tekto from Outer Planets Mod
  • Hale from Outer Planets Mod
  • Nissee from Outer Planets Mod
  • Plock and Karen from Outer Planets Mod
  • Jungis from Jungis Planet Pack
  • Ida from Kerbal Galaxy 2
  • Arin from New Horizons
  • And a LOT more!

It would be fun as well if we could expand the search to planets from other sci-fi or fantasy movies/books whatever! I wonder if it is possible to find a gas giant with life, like Bespin from Star Wars!
it is possible, in fact its fairly common!

On 2/14/2016 at 7:14 AM, A35K said:

It would be fun as well if we could expand the search to planets from other sci-fi or fantasy movies/books whatever! I wonder if it is possible to find a gas giant with life, like Bespin from Star Wars!

Bespin doesn't have life, but I have found planets similar to it in color. One problem: They're Hot Jupiters, and they're gray. Planets like Bespin are possibly near impossible to find in Space Engine, as of version 0.973.

Just today, I found a gas giant very similar, if not identical, to Lomina from the mod "Extrasolar: Planets Beyond Kerbol". Both are blue, cool ice giants with rings divided into multiple gaps. Both have 5 moons. In fact, two of those moons are nearly identical. The middle moon of the SE Lomina is an oceania like Javine, and the second-to-last moon of SE Lomina is a purple desert like Deemo. I have never found more than 1 SE-KSP similarities from the same mod around the same planet, which is also similar to a KSP planet.

I also found another purple desert that, despite being ocean-less, is a lot like Eve. I also found a ringed Duna-like moon, a cool gas giant like Jool, and an alien version of Laythe with green skies.

Here are some of the bodies I have come across in Space Engine that resemble KSP planets:

LAYTHE (Alien Version)

APHRODITE (Kerbal Galaxy 2)

CITE (Kerbal Galaxy 2)

EVE (Desert)

EVE (Oceania)

ERNUS-SHAYLE HYBRID (New Horizons/Kerbol Plus)

CITE (Icy Version)

JOOL

ODYSSEUS and ATHENA (Odysseus Planet Pack)

PLANET K (Dark Secrets)

RYLA/SARNUS (Kerbal Galaxy 2/Outer Planets Mod)

Alien Laythe has land masses, but they're tiny and hidden under the atmosphere.
